page.title: 03The village of Spaunton
page.content: A single street village of 3 farms,1 small holding & 10 houses one of which is cruck construction & several outlying cottages. One problem of living in Spaunton today is that the water has to be pumped up the hill from Lastingham so when there is no electric power,there is no water. At one time a{Mell Supper}was held in someones barn when the last of the harvest was brought in. Huge hams together with game pie & frumenty were served. Gale beer was drunk,this was made by pouring boiling over a small bunch of gale or bog myrtle,adding lemons,nettles & sugar. After supper the tables were cleared away & a fiddler played. Corn dollies made from the last sheaf of the harvest were always hung from the rafters to ensure next years harvest.
